de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.filters

Class AbstractFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.filters.AbstractFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetworkDataSink, NetworkDataSource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbsoluteFilter, AveragingFilter, DifferenceThresholdFilter, IntegratingFilter, MinimumAmplitudeChangeFilter, ScalingFilter, TemporaryIntegratingFilter, ThresholdingFilter, ThroughputMeasurer, UserSensitivityMultiplicator

    public abstract class AbstractFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetworkDataSink, NetworkDataSource
    This abstract filter implements a lot of the interface methods used by the inherited classes and provides the DataSink. Used to create a new filter usable by the data pipeline.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private NetworkDataSink mDataSink
      The data sink all data processed by this filter will be dumped into

      • getNextDataSink

        protected NetworkDataSink getNextDataSink()
        This retrieves the next pipeline element
        Returns:
        the NetworkDataSink that is due to receive the data next

      • forwardData

        protected boolean forwardData(NetworkDevice origin,
                              SensorData data,
                              float sensitivity)
        This forwards the given data to the next pipeline element. It is a convenience function that calls NetworkDataSink.onData(NetworkDevice, SensorData, float) on the next pipeline element.

        Be aware that this function does *nothing* if the next pipeline element is null. It can be set using either AbstractFilter(NetworkDataSink) or setDataSink(NetworkDataSink).

        Parameters:
        origin - the network device which sent the data
        data - the sensor data
        sensitivity - 0-100 inclusive. unless you consciously want to modify the user sensitivity (for example, because you modify the data to mirror the sensitivity setting) this should just forward the sensitivity parameter.
        Returns:
        true if a next pipeline element was found.

      • hasNextPipelineElement

        public boolean hasNextPipelineElement()
        Whether this filter element has a next pipeline element set using either AbstractFilter(NetworkDataSink) or setDataSink(NetworkDataSink).
        Returns:
        true if the next pipeline element is not null

      • close

        public void close()
        Interface requirement. Does not do anything in this implementation.
        Specified by:
        close in interface NetworkDataSink
        Specified by:
        close in interface NetworkDataSource
